content: yarn~ until bor with cc knit across the second half of the stitches on your needle to one stitch before bor with your right needle pick up the stitch below the last stitch foot and place it on the left needle and knit that stitch to create a second stitch place the new stitch on the left needle you row 1 | slip bor marker knit across to marker knit in stitch should have made a twin stitch turn your work pattern *k3 p1* to bor this continues the ribbing on the top of the foot and stockinette on the bottom row 2 | purl across to one stitch before marker place last stitch on right needle with left needle pick up stitch repeat row 1 until you have reached the appropriate length for your below the last stitch and place it on the right needle and purl foot this should be 1 5 shorter than your foot length ~cut your mc yarn~ that stitch to create a second stitch place the new twin stitch back on your left needle turn your work toe row 3 | knit across to one stitch before the twin stitch make a twin out of that stitch and move the twin to the left needle turn pick up cc and knit one row transfer stitches to your long circular your work needle to work the toe in magic loop with half of the stitches on each needle row 4 | purl across to one stitch before the twin stitch make a row 1 | k1 ssk k to three stitches before end of row k2tog twin out of that stitch and move the twin to the left needle turn k1 repeat on the second needle your work row 2 | knit across both needles repeat row 3 and 4 until 10/10/12/12 stitches remain in between the twin stitches repeat row 1 and 2 until 16/16/18/18 stitches remain on each needle 6/6/6/6 decreases repeat row 1 until 8/10/10/12 stitches remain on each needle 4/4/4/5 decreases use kitchener stitch to graft the stitches together to close the toe written by weave in your ends block your socks and enjoy sarah banks @stockinette_sarah
